result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Arraignment

3:05 PM Defendant Amaree A. Goodall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kim Marie Zion appeared by video for Amaree A. Goodall.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kim Rau appeared by video for victim witness office. Victim T.J. appeared by video. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.

2:33 PM Defendant Amaree A. Goodall appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kim Marie Zion appeared by video for Amaree A. Goodall.  Attorney Anne Theresa Nack in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to dismiss filed by defense. Court denies motion.
Arraignment scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
